intro: Actinophyllum troyanum, commonly known as the Troyanum mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. The botanical features of Actinophyllum troyanum make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
